x-data.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

Defines a chunk of HTML as an Alpine component and provides the reactive data for that component to reference.

x-init.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

Allows you to hook into the initialization phase of any element in Alpine.

x-show.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

One of the most useful and powerful directives in Alpine. It provides an expressive way to show and hide DOM elements.

x-bind.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

Allows you to set HTML attributes on elements based on the result of JavaScript expressis.

x-on.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

Allows you to easily run code on dispatched DOM events.

.prevent (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

The equivalent of calling `.preventDefault()` inside a listener on the browser event object.

.stop (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

A convenience helper for listening for a click outside of the element it is attached to.

.outside (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

The equivalent of calling `.stopPropagation()` inside a listener on the browser event object.

.window (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

Alpine will register the event listener on the root `window` object on the page instead of the element itself.

.document (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

It works similarly to `.window` only it registers listeners on the `document` global, instead of the `window` global.

.once (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

Ensures that the handler is only called once.

.debounce (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

Sometimes it is useful to "debounce" an event handler so that it only is called after a certain period of inactivity (250 milliseconds by default).

If you wish to lengthen or shorten the debounce time, you can do so by trailing a duration after the `.debounce` modifier like so:

<input @input.debounce.500ms="fetchResults">

.throttle (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

Similar to `.debounce` except it will release a handler call every 250 milliseconds instead of deferring it indefinitely.

If you wish to lengthen or shorten the debounce time, you can do so by trailing a duration after the `.throttle` modifier like so:

<input @scroll.window.throttle.750ms="handleScroll">

.self (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

Ensures that the event originated on the element it is declared on and not from a child element.

.camel (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

When used, Alpine will listen for `customEvent` instead of `custom-event`.

.dot (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

When used, Alpine will listen for `custom.event` instead of `custom-event`.

.passive (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

If you are listening for touch events, it's important to add `.passive` to your listeners to not block scroll performance.

.lazy (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

Force an `x-model` input to only update the property when user focuses away from the input element.

.number (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

Force an `x-model` input to store the value as a JavaScript number.

.delay (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

Delay a transition.

.duration (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

Set the transition duration.

.opacity (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

Apply the opacity transition only.

.scale (x-modifier).description:
Modifier for Alpine.js.

Apply the scale transition only.

x-text.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

Sets the text content of an element to the result of a given expression.

x-html.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

Sets the "innerHTML" property of an element to the result of a given expression.

x-model.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

Allows you to bind the value of an input element to Alpine data.

x-modelable.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

Allows you to expose any Alpine property as the target of the x-model directive.

x-for.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

Allows you to create DOM elements by iterating through a list.

x-transition (helper).description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

Alpine provides a robust transitions utility out of the box. With a few `x-transition` directives, you can create smooth transitions between when an element is shown or hidden.

x-transition (classes).description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

Alpine provides a robust transitions utility out of the box. With a few `x-transition` directives, you can create smooth transitions between when an element is shown or hidden.

x-effect.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

A useful directive for re-evaluating an expression when one of its dependencies change. You can think of it as a watcher where you don't have to specify what property to watch, it will watch all properties used within it.

x-ignore.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

If for some reason, you don't want Alpine to touch a specific section of your HTML, you can prevent it from doing so using `x-ignore`.

x-ref.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

`x-ref` in combination with `$refs` is a useful utility for easily accessing DOM elements directly. It's most useful as a replacement for APIs like `getElementById` and `querySelector`.

x-cloak.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

Hides the element it's attached to until Alpine is fully loaded on the page.

x-teleport.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

Allows you to transport part of your Alpine template to another part of the DOM on the page entirely.

x-if.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

Used for toggling elements on the page, similarly to `x-show`, however it completely adds and removes the element it's applied to rather than just changing its CSS display property to "none".

x-id.description:
Directive for Alpine.js.

Allows you to declare a new "scope" for any new IDs generated using `$id()`. It accepts an array of strings (ID names) and adds a suffix to each `$id('...')` generated within it that is unique to other IDs on the page.
